item.title: B Positive S01E12 영어 표현
item.description: 1. well-off유복한, 부유한. - Samantha: A doctor. Do you have a-a practice in the city? - Doctor: No, I travel around the world helping children in need. - Samantha: Oh, that’s so wonderful. Do you work for one of those big, worldwide organizations? - Doctor: No, I’m on my own. One-man band. - Samantha: Oh. Well, you must be pretty well-off to be flying all over the world.

item.title: The Unicorn S02E12 영어 표현
item.description: 1. fast단식하다, 절식하다; 금식하다. - Wade: Aren’t you supposed to fast when you have a colonoscopy? 2. account이유. - Michelle: Look, I know you’re trying to be nice to Meg on my account, but you don’t have to be. 3. break off sthto end a relationship. - Wade: I mean, I know we did the right thing be breaking it off. 4. clean as a whistleextremely clean. - Ben: All good.

item.title: Modern Family S01E06 영어 표현
item.description: 1. have/know sth down patto know something so well that you can say or do it without having to try or think. - Jay: I wasn’t the greatest husband the first time around, but, I’m tyring to do better this time. And maybe by my third marriage, I’ll have it down pat. 2. mean to~ 할 셈이다. - Phil: What ya reading there? A book? - Claire: Yeah. I’ve been meaning to get to it for a while.

item.title: The Unicorn S02E08 영어 표현
item.description: 1. give off풍기다. - Jared: Uh, this is a liability release form. I need you and your husband to sign it. - Shannon: What? Him? - Wade: Yo-You thought that we were together? - Shannon: That’s so funny. No, no, no, no, no. - Wade: No, we’re not together. I mean, we came here together, but we’re not married or anything. - Shannon: Do we give off that vibe?

item.title: B Positive S01E07 영어 표현
item.description: 1. tableto delay discussion of a subject. - Gina: I can see your lips moving, but I can not hear you talking. - Drew: Uh… Why don’t we table this for later? 2. get under sb’s skinto annoy someone. - Gina: She said my crazy kidney guy left her a snarky-ass message about how great I am that really got under her skin. 3. be/get carried awayto become so excited about something that you do not control what you say or do.

item.title: The Unicorn S02E06 영어 표현
item.description: 1. flat out딱 부러지게, 완전히. - Cynthia: And I love his family and his dogs, but I told him flat out, I won’t do that with Butch in the room. 2. ill at easefeeling anxious and not relaxed. - Wade: Yeah, uh, Forrest got a deal online, but they make him nervous. - Forrest: Nah, more ill at ease, let’s say. 3. get off on the right/wrong footto make a successful/unsuccessful start in something.

item.title: B Positive S01E06 영어 표현
item.description: 1. grow a pair[Verb] (vulgar,idiomatic) To be brave; to show some courage, especially in a situation in which one has so far failed to do so. - Gideon: You’re a shrink. Can’t you get a copy of the eval and coach her through it? - Drew: Oh, no, no. I couldn’t. That would be cheating. - Samantha: Grow a pair, Bambi. 2. take the high roadto behave in a moral way when other people are not behaving morally.

item.title: Modern Family S01E02 영어 표현
item.description: 1. put one’s foot down단호한 태도를 취하다. - Phil: Sometimes a man’s gotta put his foot down and do what a man’s gotta do. 2. rub sb the wrong wayto annoy someone without intending to. - Mitchell: Her future best friend might be in that class, and I don’t wanna rub anyone the wrong way. 3. start sb off1. ~에게(~을 하기) 시작하게 하다. 2. ~가 (~을) 시작하도록 하다[돕다/이끌다]. - Danielle: Okay, we’re gonna start with the Hello Dance, and then we’re gonna move on to blocks, then finger painting, and then we’re gonna do our Family Dance.

item.title: Modern Family S01E01 영어 표현
item.description: 1. totalTo damage something extremely badly. To destroy something completely. - Phil: That is totaled. 2. banister난간. - Alex: Luke got his head stuck in the banister again. 3. notch단, 단계, 급. - Gloria: No, no. He tripped him, Jay. Where’s the penalty? - Jay: Gloria, they’re 0 and 6. Let’s take it down a notch. 4. tell someone offTo tell someone that they have done something wrong and that you are angry about it.
